Certainly! Here's an improved version:

---

Water is both dry and wet. It exists as either vapor or liquid, but its overall composition remains unchanged throughout its lifecycle. This is why we say water is "always" in vapor or liquid form—because it doesn't change into ice or snow upon evaporation.

When water evaporates, it changes phase from liquid to gas (evaporate)
